adrFormatAddress: Lexington Ave & E 82nd St, New York, NY 10028, USA

originalText.text:
I had of late been experiencing problems standing erect.  A belt of pain and stiffness had stretched from hip to hip.  My muscles had locked up so much that for days I could barely stay vertical.  When Alexis placed her hands on me and applied the Art of Jin Shin, she sensed a very low energy in my lower back and spine.

Alexis gave me one Jin Shin session for each of 6 days.  My condition immediately dramatically improved.  Along with physical therapy, her work has enabled me to move into a new groove, where standing up is natural instead of effortful.  My gratitude to her is so great, I told her she made me think of a Renaissance Madonna by Fra Filippo Lippi.

Alexis is a refined, subtle, kind, focused, infinitely compassionate, and gently powerful healer.

originalText.text: Life in Manhattan can be intense…sometimes we need a break from everything…a moment to just breathe and relax.  Just entering Alexis’s zen Jin Shin studio oasis is enough to bring my shoulders down from my ears!  I have been going for sessions with Alexis for a long time, but had to take a break during COVID.  My whole body ached to return and recently I did.  Alexis is a true healer.  Last week I went in with lower back spasms that had been plaguing me.  Advil and chair massages did nothing, but an hour with Alexis’s therapeutic hands completely alleviated the pain.  I am so grateful.  Alexis is amazing and I highly recommend working with her.

originalText.text: I found Alexis Brink’s Jin Shin Jyutsu Self-Help class to be a wonderful way to reconnect with the breath, body, innermost self, and with others for renewal and self-healing. Alexis brings a passion for Jin Shin Jyutsu and a deep knowledge of the art. She expertly guided us to listen more attentively to what our bodies are saying and then to respond with the gentle care of Jin Shin self-help.  I left Alexis’ class with a relaxed and freer breath, a greater sense of well-being, and self-help exercises tailored specifically for my needs!

originalText.text: I go to Alexis for a session whenever I have chest tightness and by the end of the session I feel completely clear. The environment in which the session is done is very relaxing and enhances the healing. I would recommend Jin Shin to anyone with any general health issues, or to simply feel balanced physically and mentally.

originalText.text: This center is a hidden gem on the upper east side! You are transported to a world of calm, relaxation, and deep healing in an environment that is totally "zen". Alexis is an authentic, talented healer and teacher. It's very special to receive a session at this center. In addition, the practice circles and classes that are offered are unique opportunity to learn self care.
